subject: Re: [junit] junit 4+ and ant task
messageBody:
GOOGLE junit4testadapter

On 5/26/07, Andrew McDonagh <andrewmcdonagh@...> wrote:
> Hi there is an extra addition to you test classes needed. google ant
> junit testsuite
>
>
> On 5/25/07, rjminsha <rjminsha@...> wrote:
> > Hi.
> >
> > Usually I invoke junit 4.1 tests in ant by invoking java directly.
> > However, I would like to leverage the xml and html formats that
> > available if I use the junit ant task.
> >
> > The junit ant task says that it works with 4.0 style junit tests but
> > when I inovke it I get a message indicating that there are not test
> > cases in my class.
> >
> > When I switch the style of my tests to junit 3.8 things work fine.
> >
> > Does the ant task support junit 4.x ? If so what version of ant ( did
> > not seem to in 1.7 ) ?
> >
> > If not, what is the best approach here to use junit 4.x and generate
> > xml and html output that is consistent with my 3.8 log analyzers ?
> >
> > thanks,
> > Robbie
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
